Articles.Content:
One thing i have always done is guestimated my Delta V, today is the day i want to know exactly how far i can go lol, I have seen a screen people open up that calculates their remaining delta V and i have been searching for hours to try and find what it is but i can not seem to, surely someone knows what i am talking about. (I have a feeling its mech jeb) 

Be lovely to know how many m/s the fuel left in this will get me.

![7Xojoor.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/7Xojoor.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T22:50:17Z" title="05/04/2015 10:50  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by Roflcopterkklol**

> 
> (I have a feeling its mech jeb)

Or KER, or VOID. All provide comparable readouts.

> 
> Or KER, or VOID. All provide comparable readouts.

Awesome thanks man, idk why i couldnt find an answer to that on google lol

[Isp*g0*ln(M_wet/M_dry)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsiolkovsky_rocket_equation). At present, g0 is 9.80665 m/sÃ‚Â²

You can get your current M\_wet in map view. For M\_dry, you'll need to subtract the relevant propellant mass. The ship appears oxidizer limited, so I would guess it would run through 2054/0.55 = 3734.5 units of propellant in total. At 0.005 tonnes per unit, that's 18.67 tonnes lighter than the wet mass.
